alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier heavy rainfall. * WHERE...Carroll County in Southwest Virginia. Surry County in Northwest North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways and highways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EDT, Between 6 and 8 pm from 1.0 to 2.0 inches of rain fell within the advisory area. Excessive runoff from this earlier rainfall may result in minor flooding in poor drainage areas. tThis includes locations such as Fairview, Dobson, and Lambsburg. - Fairview, Dobson, Lambsburg is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaverdam Creek, Cooks Creek, Crooked Creek, Bull Creek, Ararat River, Chestnut Creek, Cody Creek, Beaver Creek, Caddle Creek and Brushy Fork. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Dobson... Bottom... Cana... Fancy Gap... and Pine Ridge... - For additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
